dct_title_s: A New Mapp of AMERICA SEPTENTRIONALE
dct_description_sm: Dedication: "To the Right Honourable Caecilius Calvert Baron Baltemore de Baltemore Absolute Lord and Proprietary of the Provinces of Maryland and Avalon", within coat of arms. Issued in: Description of the Four Parts of the World / R. Blome. -- London, 1670. Philip Burden mentions a proof State dated 1668, otherwise unchanged.

State 2, Variant: Undated and unchanged except for new dedication: To the Worshipful Jeffery Jefferys of the Priory in Brecknokshire. Coat of arms, pasted over the dedication to the Earl of Shaftesbury. Issued in: Cosmography and Geography / R. Blome. -- London, 1693
Undated and unchanged except for new dedication: To the Rt. Hon. Anthony Earle of Shaftsbury, Baron Ashley of Wimbourne St. Giles, and Lord Cooper of Pawlet. Coat of arms bears 8 family lines.

Undated and unchanged except for new dedication: Dedicated To the Rt. Hon. Anthony Earle of Shaftesbury, Baron Ashley of Wimbourne St. Giles, and Lord Cooper of Pawlet. Coat of arms bears 2 family lines (otherwise identical with above issue). Issued in: Cosmography and Geography / R. Blome. -- London : S. Roycroft, Printer, 1682. Plate [23], precedes p.423
Designed by Mousieur [Nicolas] Sanson Geographer to the French King, and Rendred into English, and Illustrated by Richard Blome By his Majesties Especiall Command.
Wagner 400; Tooley 26 (Plate 40),27,28; Leighly 55; Mercator Society (Plate); UCB; Burden 397 (Plate 397).

Unchanged reissue of Sanson's 1650 "Amerique Septentrionale" as regards California, except that a tiny vignette of a deer is shown in the north of the island. Engraved by: Francis Lamb Sculp (lower left).
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
